summary: "Trading Places" is a 1983 comedy about a rich broker and a poor hustler whose lives switch due to a bet. Directed by John Landis, the film stars Dan Aykroyd and Eddie Murphy. Inspired by real-life rivals, the story was originally meant for Richard Pryor and Gene Wilder. Shot in Philadelphia and New York, the film was a box office hit, earning over $120 million worldwide. It received positive reviews and launched Murphy's career. Despite some criticism for racial humor, it's considered a classic comedy and Christmas film.
title: Trading Places
